review_text: The photos in the listing don't do justice to the charming room I stayed in. Jennifer has added some furnishings, such as a vintage dresser at the foot of the bed, that really make the space more cozy and comfortable. There is now a little desk in the nook that features a window overlooking the street. In early March, the tall camellias were already blooming outside the other window. One morning, I was able to enjoy a walk in the park that's only a couple blocks away. All in all, it was a great stay.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What I really appreciated about Jennifer's place was the comfortable bed. I have never stayed in an Airbnb with a bed that was actually great, but this one was amazing. Also, the other guests and the neighborhood itself were extremely quiet. Jennifer was very communicative and friendly. Something to note-- if you have a bigger vehicle (I don't), be aware that the street is narrow and twisty right where the house is. I chose this listing simply because it was close to my workplace and reasonably priced. I would say this setup might be best suited for those who don't mind interacting with other guests, though Jennifer honored my wishes and informed the other guests that I wanted to keep to myself. Overall this was an excellent value, super clean, and very comfortable.

The hosts are super nice, quick to respond, and always available for any needs. As my month was ending, I felt more like I was staying with friends and in their warm welcoming home. Highly recommend if you are visiting Salem or if working at Salem Health as it's a very close and in walking distance.

I’ve seen the Taj Mahal and crossed the Grand Canyon, but neither of those experiences come close to how great it was to be their guest.
Miranda and Kyle were the best hosts we’ve ever experienced! They were welcoming and made us feel right at home. They were flexible with our check out time and we are beyond grateful for their generosity!
The bed was extremely comfortable. Their bonus room was super fun with video games and TV and a really comfy couch and we enjoyed watching a movie in.
We have our two month old with us, and they were so kind and generous to us and adjusted the heat for our baby to feel cozy. The whole house is really well taken care of, and very clean. They gave us great recommendations of things to do in the area. Their home is the perfect layout to spend time with my little family, it’s roomy and spacious and extremely well taken care of!

Stayed over a week
review_text:
This place's a good stay. It's a nice location with a nice bedroom and bathroom. Feel like it could be better, mostly things like hosts being more mindful of the shared space.
Some things to note:
- Hosts took a while (few days?) to clean dishes in the sink (some smell with the food left behind) and there's clutter I have to often move out to do my own cooking.
- I had to tell them to not run the laundry late at night (it was around midnight) or shut the door to suppress noise
- The parking can be really bad if you had to park in the spot mentioned in the airbnb. There had to be some back and forth for me to park on an easier spot near the garage, but I feel like it should have been the spot to start out with
- There are few times the dog can bark for a really long time if the hosts are not around. Fortunately it did not happen all the time, but one time it happened for 45 minutes
- I recall the host's husband was shirtless in the kitchen once lol

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: So I am not sure why anyone rated this anything other than 5. LOVED this. Beautiful surroundings, very quiet and a gorgeous view. You could stay there for 3 days and not leave. The place is immaculately clean and the whole design is extremely tasteful. The hot tub looks over a gorgeous forest and you can sit in it at night and watch the stars and occasional owl that flies by. The kitchen is minimalistic, do not plan to do a lot of cooking but has everything and LeAnne leaves you with a box of goodies and treats and water bottles (even though the tap water is perfect since it comes from an aquafer). Consider bringing some simple meals. Because it is in the middle of nature you have to drive a few minutes to get to for restaurants and stores but all very doable. If you are looking for a weekend of R and R and be close to a few natural parks and hikes (Silverfalls is 40 minutes drive) this is THE place to stay. LeAnne herself is amazing, kind and helpful.

When I met the host in the morning, she said she was aware of the handrail issue and had informed her husband. However, he seems to be procrastinating, putting tenants at risk by neglecting the problem. She also mentioned reminding her husband. Well, that's that... nice.

It’s hard to stay in a stuffy hotel, when there is a beautiful AirBNB available. And this one was perfect.
The hot tub was spotless and toasty. We soaked a few times during our short stay. I loved the high vaulted ceiling and the loft was very cozy. The kitchen literally had everything you need and more. Coffee, creamer, sugar, steel cut oats, chocolate, popcorn and water. There was even a toothbrush and toothpaste in the bathroom. I have never seen that at any place we have stayed.
Place was spotless and smelled amazing, the bed was ultra soft and cozy. I could have nuzzled up in there for much longer than we had time for.
Thank you for the last minute availability and the cozy place. Highly recommended.

This stay features a grand living and dining room for visiting and watching T.V, a comfortable bed, bathroom amenities and kitchen utensils that would be good for cooking a small meal.
We would recommend the Red Barn to anyone looking for hiking trails or wineries with a welcoming place to unwind when you return.
We will definitely keep this place in mind when we return to the area. Thank you LeAnne!

review_text: The Red Barn in the countryside just south of Salem is a delight. Spacious and light-filled, this clean and quiet place is a relaxing and comfortable option for this area. We were able to easily scoot into town during our visit to access multiple stores, restaurants and places to visit. There’s designated parking right out front and a hot tub on a private deck for further relaxation. And, you can even walk just up the road to a local winery! We were so comfortable here.

review_text: We had a wonderful time staying at LeAnne’s AirBnB. The location felt “off the beaten path,” but was a relatively short drive from Silver Falls State Park where we hiked during our stay, as well as downtown Salem where we went for dinner both nights of our stay (thanks to our host for the restaurant recommendations). It was clean, cozy, and private, and the hot tub was fantastic with a great view from the deck. A/C worked great, WiFi was easy to access, parking was simple, location was not hard to find, water quality was perfectly fine, and we had pretty much everything we needed in terms of amenities and then some (see the hot tub). And while there are many wineries in the area, the one just down the road has a really fantastic view.

The hot tub was perfect, the view at night was beautiful. She was attentive with us and check in was very easy. The coffee was perfect, bathroom was clean and the the beds were comfortable. review_text: This was a dream staycation, the place had everything we needed for a relaxing birthday getaway, away from the city. LeAnne was also grade A helpful with anything we needed and kept the place looking top notch. The private hot tub on the balcony overlooking the tree’s was dreamy, we got to soak while it was raining with the help of the perfectly sized patio umbrella, also the loft vibes inside with the spiral staircase were immaculate. We cooked dinner, drank wine, listened to music, played games, soaked in the hot tub & took naps and it was perfect. We will definitely be booking again.

review_text: A stunning, modern taste of culture and comfort! Lillian provided us with easy check in, tasteful decor, spacious floor plan and many worthwhile suggestions for activities and restaurants! We stayed one night, but the moment we walked in, we wished we had booked longer. We tried some of the local recommendations for restaurants and sights to see and highly recommend the next guests do the same. The home was private and cozy in the vineyard. I cannot speak more highly of this. We loved waking up to see the beautiful valley and vineyard before you! Not only that, but the place itself was fully stocked with every amenity you could think of - and I’m high maintenance! Everything a guest could want and more! I always go into these places expecting I’ll need to buy extra shampoo or bring my own snacks, but Lillian went above and beyond with this listing and I’ll be honest, it’s those little thoughtful gestures that made this feel like home. It quickly became our dream home away from home!

Note for those needing wifi, the place comes with a mofi but it's not quite as strong as you might need for internet work/video calls. I hotspotted to my own phone for the week and cell service is absolutely fine so it did the trick. Would definitely recommend this spot for anyone wanting to explore the area from a relaxing home base.

review_text:
Hard to describe our stay as anything other than "perfect." Lillian was such an excellent communicator and check-in was a breeze. The house itself is filled with natural light, impeccably designed, extremely comfortable, and located in the most relaxing setting among the vines on a very private property. The kitchen is well-equipped and we cooked ourselves the majority of the meals during our four night stay (just a heads-up that there is a stove-top but no oven). The shower was excellent and the bed very comfortable. It didn't effect us because we were there with the purpose of wine tasting and unplugging but the wifi was a little spotty at times.
I'm not kidding when I say that this is the only place we'll ever stay when we visit the Willamette Valley.

review_text: This is a top-notch sanctuary for two. The house was very well-appointed, even down to the various items in the bathroom and shower. Simple, elegant, modern, comfortable. The bed and pillows were awesome. We kept all the doors and windows open when we were there, loving the inside/outside feeling. We cooked in and had cocktails on the porch in the rocking chairs. The house is on a short dead-end street, so it's quiet and peaceful. About five minutes away is a huge park along the Willamette River that is great for longer and more strenuous walking. Our host was so kind and attentive and we absolutely loved their dog, Scooter, who we coaxed into visiting us whenever possible. We will definitely stay here again when we are in the area.

Stayed with kids
review_text: We stayed here for an annual convention and the place was awesome! I’d say the only downfall is there are no bathtubs. I have two toddlers who scream at the sight of showers lol. Of course, that is no fault of the owners, just my lack of reading. Otherwise, backyard was amazing for our kids to run around, fully fenced. There was a toddler bed provided and some toys in the house and outside. The house also has child locks on the cabinets! Besides the no baths, it is very toddler friendly, as there is not a lot of clutter for kids to get into. The hosts were very friendly and proactive in making sure we arrived and got in okay. As well as very responsive when I messaged them. House was clean and very spacious. And the neighborhood was nice! Definitely would recommend this place!

name: Ramond
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I’m starting this review on my first day arriving for a 5 day stay because I already know I’m going to have a lot to say, and I don’t want to write a rushed review. I arrived on Easter Sunday. Mary Lou let me check in 2 hours before check in, even though they were totally doing family Easter in the main house. She walked me through the BEAUTIFUL garden to the guest house, and made sure I had everything I needed (including a plate of Easter Sunday lunch <3). I spent the next two hours walking around the neighborhood. I cannot express in words how gorgeous the neighborhood is. I took MANY photos :) I finished the evening on my personal patio, which conveniently sits perfectly in the sun all afternoon until practically sunset. Prefer the shade in the afternoon? Don’t worry, the garden bellow is filled with beautiful shrubs and flowers and comfortable seating. Not to mention the welded metal sculptures and other charming original pieces of art perfectly scatter throughout the foliage. Needless to say, I ended my first night in absolute heaven.
The following days were more of the same. Mary Lou periodically checked on me to ensure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. As days passed, I discovered more tasteful and entertaining special touches. For example, I loved the small jar of color pencils and hardback sketch book for guests to fill with notes and sketches. Of course, I also took many more walks around the neighborhood and neighboring parks (yes multiple. And they’re ALL beautiful).
The apartment was stocked with complimentary snacks and breakfast items. Coffee and tea were also provided. I know this is going to sound strange...but the soap and shampoo was sooooooo nice. The bathroom is also stocked with soft fluffy towels and an array of personal hygiene items. This requires a great deal of attention to detail, but it makes a WORLD of a difference.
I could go on and on about how perfect this experience was for me, but I think I’ve made my point. Stop looking. Book this space. It’s comfortable, beautiful, and unforgettable. <3

review_text: Our daughter goes to Willamette in Salem and in the past we have stayed in one of the few hotels Salem offers. Never again. The loft exceeded our expectations and was less expensive than most hotel rooms in the area. It is well appointed and comfortable. The bedding was incredibly comfortable and the loft is filled with beautiful paintings. We found ourselves admiring the art often (it feels like a quaint gallery). The loft sits above their detached garage and is accessible from the alley behind their main house. It is private yet you have the benefit of having access to the beautiful backyard. This will be our go to place until our daughter graduates and we will certainly tell other parents about it.

review_text: This is the best Air BnB I've ever stayed in. It was beautiful (used to be an art gallery!) and so thoughtfully prepared - Mary Lou left out detailed lists of recommended restaurants and things to do in Salem (including a free pass to a local art museum), snacks, and everything. Definitely check out the restaurants, they were So Good. There was also a cute little logbook where guests could leave notes and drawings for future guests to read. The loft was spotlessly clean, private, and air conditioned! The bed was comfy, there was a TV with Netflix, wifi, and extra of anything we might need. And to top it all off, Mary Lou and her husband were the nicest people ever! 10/10 would recommend staying here, it was the highlight of our trip.

name: Laura
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had high hopes, but it was truly even better than I had expected. It was such a unique and interesting space-- something I always look for in an AirBnB. And nothing was sacrificed in terms of amenities and conveniences. We had our own separate parking area right at the loft. The way that the space fully functions as an art gallery and a comfortable living space, using these cool sliding walls, reminds me of some of the grand finales of those home makeover shows. It's just fun.
Mary Lou couldn't be a warmer host. And one night she and her husband happened to be having marionberry pie-- an Oregon specialty that we had never heard of. She warmed up two pieces and brought it over to us. We are not particularly fond of pies in general, but I'm telling you that this was the most amazing pie we had ever had. Not only that, but it introduced us to a cool local Oregon fruit that we wouldn't have gotten in any other state, but would likely have missed out on if not for Mary Lou!
The neighborhood is so beautiful-- every house different and so cool-looking. And located just a a few minutes from Willamette University.
I couldn't recommend more highly!

name: Lori
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Staying at Mary Lou’s was fantastic. The loft was decorated with some amazing pieces of art and its layout was perfect. After each day’s adventures, it was so relaxing to come back and catch our breath. And it wasn’t just the loft, it was the entire neighborhood. Downstairs from the loft, there was a cozy outdoor “room” with a firepit, were we could sit and have a drink and go through the pictures of the day. Art was everywhere, from paintings to statues to mobiles….it was so comfortable and welcoming. Even looking out the windows, everyone in the area had these beautiful gardens and landscapes to brighten everything up. We were surrounded by gardens full of everything from roses to wildflowers. Every night, after coming back from our adventures, we would take time to simply walk around the block. The entire neighborhood had lots of little corner gardens with mixes of full blooms or bushes of blueberries and blackberries, huge trees, hidden pathways…. the neighborhood itself was almost a huge public park, where a walk down the sidewalk was one picture perfect setting after another.
Mary Lou is a fantastic host. She made sure we had coffee, snacks, sundries, and every other little thing that made the experience so wonderful. And if that wasn’t enough, on our last day, as we were packing our car to head out, she came out to say goodbye and give us a bag full of chocolate chip cookies she had made the night before.
I highly recommend if you are visiting Salem, check out Mary Lou’s wonderful place. It was a perfect launchpad for our visit to Oregon (where we travelled from the Coast to Silver Falls State Park to the Downtown Salem Saturday Farmers Market) with truly gracious hosts.

I appreciated that the hosts were also fine with me having my sister stay with me throughout my stay. The only thing that could be improved is the wifi - it was spotty in various places in the loft. I imagine this is because the loft is streaming from the house. That said, the still worked fairly well and the art on the walls and beauty of the loft itself made up for spotty wifi. I'd highly recommend this spot to other folks.

They completely accommodated and were able to get the space ready hours early! Beyond that, I mentioned it was me and my wife's anniversary, and they even had a bottle of wine waiting for us! Everything else was great. Extremely clean, lots of supplies to do laundry or cook with, nice bathroom. This is the kind of place that can really make your visit to Salem that much better.

Our hosts were incredibly thoughtful and welcoming. Very kind and genuine people. We felt especially safe here, and the location is quite charming and quiet, but with easy access into town if you need to pick anything up or grab food. Check-in was easy and communication timely and helpful. The space was much larger than we had anticipated and very comfortable and "homey." The accommodations were comfortable, and our hosts were even extra thoughtful by turning a lamp on in the space for us before we came home in the evening after it was dark.
Bonus perk: My hair was softer after washing it in the shower there than it has been in years with our over-treated, extra-hard water back at home. I didn't even know my hair was capable of being that soft and shiny. It was a nice vacation for my hair as well as the rest me.

review_text: Diane and Tom are the epitome of the Perfect Airbnb hosts! After a week on the road, their place was a peaceful haven to relax, refresh and reboot! Diane reached out ahead of our arrival to make sure we knew how to get there, where we could park and how to get inside. Upon our arrival, Diane greeted us to ensure everything was to our liking, ask us if we wanted wood for the outside fire pit and if there was anything she could do to make our stay more comfortable. She even left some snacks for us and cool water from their well. After that she disappeared, giving us our privacy. The place is more spacious than it looks in the pictures and it is SUPER clean! The bed is comfortable, the water pressure in the shower is strong, and the inside and outside are charming. I HIGHLY recommend staying at the Country Garden Retreat!

name: Kathy
rating_info:

·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We spent a weekend at Diane's place while visiting our daughter who attends Corban. It was a perfect location for that purpose, right by the campus. We have stayed at various hotels in Salem, and this was so much more convenient and comfortable. The rooms were clean and quiet; the view out the windows onto a garden and wooded area, with a bit of a view of the valley, was beautiful and peaceful. The hosts were very kind and welcoming, and we enjoyed chatting with them, but they also left us alone. There were many hospitable touches such as little muffins, yogurt and juice in the fridge, paper cups by the sink, coffee and cereal available, and a water dispenser that Diane kept filled for us. The kitchenette area consists of a small fridge, microwave, coffee pot, toaster, and a few supplies. There is no kitchen sink or counters, nor freezer to speak of (although I've no doubt Diane would have put something in her freezer for us if we'd asked --- she was very accommodating). An extra table somewhere to provide more "counter" space would be helpful. But in general, if you are planning on eating in, keep it simple, with items that don't require a lot of prep or freezer space, and you’ll do great. All in all, a very nice stay and we will definitely be back!

name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is an absolute gem in the AirBnB world. Guests have the whole bottom floor of the house - a HUGE living area, large bedroom and large bathroom (shower, not tub). Everything is very clean and feels well cared for. As the description indicates, there is no real 'kitchen' - in particular, no sink, and you do not do dishes in the bathroom sink (the house is on septic). BUT, Diane does provide a way to have the basic dishes (glasses, plates, bowls, silverware) washed upstairs. So heating things in the microwave, or having other foods that don't require a full-on kitchen are fine. In addition to the incredible comfort, cleanliness and spaciousness of this lodging, the outdoor space is amazing - you have your own patio, with seating and fire pit, and a truly gorgeous view - a hilly oak tree savannah landscape. It's quiet, peaceful and beautiful. It's about a 10-15 minute drive to 'downtown' Salem, but there are lots of restaurants, shops etc, even closer. We had a great stay at Diane's (and Tom's), and would definitely stay again.

My husband and I used this as a two get away. I’d highly recommend it.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Tom and Diane were both wonderful!
The house is conveniently located close to the city, but the tranquility and peacefulness is countryside living at its best. There is also a nice view of some city lights in the evening and if the weathers just right a beautiful sunset too!
Their home was the perfect retreat and respite I needed while spending time with my father during his recovery at Salem hospital.
Tom sent me some supportive text messages to help keep my spirits up, and Diane kept the little refrigerator well stocked and I was able to enjoy a little breakfast each morning. I really did feel spoiled and didn’t even have to do the dishes!
I couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Tom also gave me a departing gift of some rhubarb from his garden.
Thank you both for everything!
Susie

review_text: This is the friendliest Airbnb we've yet experienced! Diane and Tom were both amazingly friendly and helpful. The space is also larger than any Airbnb we've been in. They have a great garden too. We felt well-provider for: among plenty of other things, we were given in-season fruit, a delicious scone, and high-quality well water. The place is located at the edge of town in a beautiful, extremely quiet country environment. The final morning, we were pleasantly surprised to find that a protective kitty was lounging on our doormat at the glass door. It disappeared before we could greet it.
